item.description:
I KnoW I knOW I KnoW…

YOu neeD NoT teLL mE aBoUT NED!!!
YoU muST thINK mE CRaZY iN thE HeAD.
NevErTHeLeSS, maY I huMBLY aSK oF yOU,
WithoUT ThiNKING I'vE GoNE AsKEW?
WhEN LOokING foR A WoRD tO RHyME WiTH SleD,
HOw CouLD I ChoOSE PieRcE OvER NED???


 

 

So here’s what I have in mind… a hike to Ike should weather permit, by way of the Crawford Path I submit, but should the weather turn fierce, we’ll head to Jackson, by way of Mount Pierce.


In other words, the plan is to hike to Mount Eisenhower by following the Crawford Path, spending approximately 2 1/2 to 3 hrs along the ridge, ducking in and out of cover, while holding our hand to jaw as we bear witness to the breath taking awe of winter's "Presidential" wonders... but only if we have favorable weather. Should we discover high-high winds, or cold-cold temps at the summits, or should the conditions stray too far from agreeable, we’ll choose to stay among the comfort of the trees and hike to Mount Jackson instead (and no... I'm not trying to rhyme with Ned).

About The Hike

We’ll begin just off Route 302, at the Crawford Connector Trailhead, hiking just under a half mile before turning north (left) onto the Crawford Path. Along the way, we’ll meet up with a spur trail that leads to the Crawford Cliffs and its stunning views of Crawford Notch and the Willey Range, a "not to be missed" overlook. We’ll ignore the temptation. Instead, we’ll continue uphill, up a moderate grade, at a moderate pace for 2.7 miles, by-passing the Mizpah Cutoff, in favor of swiftly reaching the fantastic views on the summit and shoulder of Mount Pierce.

Near the top, at the intersection of the Crawford Path and Webster Cliff Trail, we’ll bear right onto the WCT, and complete the remaining 500 feet to Mount Pierce's summit. Turning around, we’ll head back to the Crawford Path, continue north along the ridge, hiking thru a wonderful mix of scrub and trees, and past its many views, before taking on the fully exposed summit of Ike (1.6 miles later). From here, we can look back to our past at what we've done, or look forward to the future, and dream of winter hiking days to come (that kinda rhymes). Nonetheless, at this point we'll retrace our steps and begin our walk, run or slide (yes... slide!!!) back to our cars.

This is an out and back hike, one that largely follows the Crawford Path, only diverging when following the WCT south to the summit of Pierce, or when bearing left off of the Crawford Path, to follow the 0.4 mile spur to the summit of Ike. It is also a 9.5 mile, 7+ hour hike that will demand our attention to time, trail conditions, weather and fitness, so be prepared to accept changes to our plans or pace should any of these not be in our favor.

Also, on our return from Ike, we'll don our sleds (highly recommended, but not required) for what promises to be a decent descent, to the base of where we began our ascent.


EQUIPMENT CHECKLIST
(gear must be winter weather tested)

Cold Weather/Winter Essentials (required):
• Synthetic or Wool Wicking Underpant & Undershirt
• Mid-layer Synthetic or Wool Insulating Pant & Shirt
• Insulated/Fleece Jacket and/or Vest
• Windproof/Waterproof Shell w/hood & Pant
• Synthetic or Wool Sock Liners (wicking layer)
• Synthetic or Wool Socks (insulating layer)
• Sturdy Hiking Boots (waterproof & insulated)
• Hat & Gloves
• Balaclava
• Goggles
• Extra Insulating Layers (pant & top)
• Extra pair of Socks, Hat & Gloves
• Water (min. 2L) - in a wide-mouthed bottle
• Lunch
• Snack/Energy Food (extra food)
• Map/Compass/Whistle
• Headlamp/Flashlight (w/ fresh lithium batteries)
• Emergency Blanket (so small & light, there's no reason not to carry one)
• MICROspikes or more aggressive hiking crampons
• Snowshoes
• Gaiters

the Remaining Essentials:
• Medication/First Aid Supplies*
• Hand Warmers
• Sleeping Bag & Pad*
• Light-weight Emergency Shelter/Bivy*
• Stove*
• Fire (waterproof matches, lighter, starter)
• Repair Kit/Knife

Optional:
• Sunscreen/Sunglasses/Bug Repellent/Toiletries
• Trekking Poles (very helpful when using snowshoes)
• Camera/Binoculars

* To Be Carried Among The Group

LET'S NOT UNDERESTIMATE ANYTHING; come prepared for the worst... cold-cold temps., snowy-snowy weather, early darkness and lots of wind.
ALSO... TAKE NOTE: the "Optional" list is significantly smaller than at any other time of year.


Directions

From I-93 North, take Exit 35 and drive north along Route 3 for approx. 10 miles. Turn right onto Route 302 east and continue for 8 miles; turn left onto Mt Clinton Rd. (diagonally across from the AMC Highland Center). The parking lot is about 300 feet from the main road, on your left.

From North Conway, follow Rt. 16N/302W north toward Glen, NH. At the Rt. 16/302 split, continue straight on 302 west for 20 miles; turn right onto Mt Clinton Rd just past the AMC Highland Center. The parking lot is about 300 feet from the main road, on your left.

Google maps: http://maps.google.com/maps...
Coordinates: 44.222637, -71.410972


Additional Information

Mount Pierce: 4310 feet
Mount Eisenhower: 4780 feet

Distance from trailhead to Pierce: 3.2 miles
Distance from Pierce to Ike: 1.6 miles

Total distance (round trip): approx. 9.8 miles
Total elevation gain: approx. 3700 feet

Exposure: None below Pierce; Moderate between Pierce & Ike; Full on the summit of Ike
Difficulty: Moderate/Strenuous
Pace: Moderate (We'll need to average 1.3 to 1.5 mph to meet our 7 hour goal.)

Sunrise: 6:54 a.m.
Sunset: 5:07 p.m.

Approx. High Temp: Cold
Approx. Low Temp: Really Really Cold

10-Day Weather.com Outlook:
http://www.weather.com/weather/tenday/Crawford+Notch...

7-Day National Weather Forecast (NOAA):
http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php...

6-Day Mountain-Forecast.com:
http://www.mountain-forecast.com/peaks/Mount-Eisenhower/forecasts/1541

Mt. Washington Observatory Higher Summits Forecast:
http://www.mountwashington.org/weather/summit_forecast.php

Weather & Trail Conditions (AMC):
http://www.outdoors.org/recreation/tripplanner/go/backcountry-weather.cfm

Weather & Trail Conditions (TrailsNH):
http://trailsnh.com/New-Hampshire-4000-Footers.php


Liability Waiver

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: Parking is located diagonally across from the AMC Highland Center in Crawford Notch State Park, just off Rt. 302 on Mt. Clinton Road; cell: 860-460-1500
item.name: Hike Ike, Sled Ned (reSchEDuLEd)
